channel.title: If Books Could Kill

ns1:owner.ns1:name: If Books Could Kill Mile High Club

channel.ns1:author: If Books Could Kill Mile High Club

image.title: If Books Could Kill Mile High Club

item.title: DEI Bart DEI
item.description:
Conservatives are freaking out about Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the workplace, so Michael and Peter do a medium-to-deep dive on the subject. We talk about what workplace DEI aspires to be, how it falls short, and why the right is stirring up a moral panic about it.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

As always, leave suggestions for bonus episodes in the comments!

item.title: The Worst Takes of 2023
item.description:
For our final episode of 2023, we look back on a year full of terrible opinions. 

A special thanks to all of our subscribers for being part of our first full year!  There are many more bad takes to come and we look forward to suffering alongside you.

item.title: Pundit Portraits: Kathleen Parker and Chris Cillizza
item.description:
This episode is the first in an ongoing series wherein Peter and Michael explore the brains of America's pundits. We start with Kathleen Parker, the platonic ideal of a rich white lady, and Chris Cillizza, a pioneer in talking about politics without saying anything.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

As always, leave suggestions for bonus episodes in the comments!

item.title: The "Organized Retail Crime" Panic
item.description:
Retailers have been sounding the alarm about a shoplifting epidemic driven by organized criminal syndicates. In a shocking twist, it turns out that their story is mostly made up. Join us as Peter tries to figure out where this panic originated and as Mike finally comes clean about his criminal past.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

As always, leave suggestions for bonus episodes in the comments!

item.title: The Clinton E-Mail Scandal
item.description:
But her e-mails! Michael explains the non-scandal that captivated the mainstream media in 2016 while Peter attempts to sow the podcast with anti-Hillary sentiment.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

As always, leave suggestions for bonus episodes in the comments!

item.title: 'On Bullsh*t' and the Pundit Industrial Complex
item.description:
Michael and Peter dissect Harry Frankfurt's seminal essay "On Bullsh*t" and discuss the types of nonsense that are perpetually cascading through our media and politics.

NOTE: If it sounds like we're being weirdly harsh to a guy who just died, that's because we recorded this in June, before it happened. RIP Harry. Nothing will ever make us respect an author more than refusing to use filler. 

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

As always, leave suggestions for bonus episodes in the comments!

item.title: Are The Straights OK?
item.description:
Michael and Peter discuss the ways in which the paradigm shift toward online dating has damaged our brains and hardened our hearts.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

If you have suggestions for bonus episode content, let us know!

item.title: Conservatives vs. Pride Month
item.description:
To celebrate Pride Month, we are discussing the right's coordinated assault on rainbow-colored retail displays.

You can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

If you have suggestions for bonus episode content, let us know in the comments!

item.title: The Meme Stock Cult
item.description:
In 2021, scrappy young investors from across the world joined forces to buy GameStop stock, aiming to take down greedy hedge funds. What came next was tragedy, injustice, and a conspiratorial internet cult so stupid we had to do an episode about it.

As always, you can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon.

If you have suggestions for bonus episode content, let us know in the comments!

Later this week: Nudge, pt. 2: The Nudgening

item.title: Ben Shapiro's Bootstrappy Plan To Solve Poverty
item.description:
On the heels of our Rich Dad Poor Dad episode we're doing a deep dive into the ideology of the "success sequence," the preferred poverty alleviation strategy of the conservative intelligentsia. 

Here's the clip of Ben Shapiro breaking it down. Warning: Contains Ben Shapiro.

As always, you can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon. 

We're using the next few bonus episodes to riff on random stuff we've been thinking about — stay tuned for a Gamestop subreddit mega-sode — so let us know in the comments if you've seen anything bouncing around the internet we should look into. 

Next week: The Five Love Languages

item.title: The Dumbest Campus Controversies Of The Last Decade
item.description:
Get in loser, we're going to Oberlin.

As always, you can play this episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon. Drop a line in the comments if you've got requests for future bonus episodes.

Next week: Rich Dad Poor Dad!

P&M

item.title: The New York Times's War On Trans Kids
item.description:
The nation's most prestigious newspaper insists on asking a very stupid question. So for this month's bonus episode, we decided to answer it. 

If you're new here, welcome! As we mentioned on the main feed, we're donating this month's support to Parker Molloy, Katelyn Burns and Evan Urquhart, three of our trans journo-friends who've been unbelievably patient with Mike as he's navigated the science and politics of this issue over the last year. Like and subscribe! 

You can play the episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon. As ever, drop a line in the comments if you've got requests for future bonus episodes.

Next week: The Coddling Of The American Mind. 

See you then!

P&M

item.title: The Lab Leak
item.description:
In December 2019, the coronavirus pandemic began in Wuhan, China. In May 2021, America experienced one of the most cursed weeks of punditry we've ever seen.

This one's a doozy. You can play the episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions. 

Let us know in the comments if you've got suggestions for next month's bonus. Our next two episode-episodes are on "The End of History" and "The Clash of Civilizations," so we'll be in the mood for something that will not require us to learn any history, engage with any philosophy or stare at any color-coded maps.

It's airborne, 

Peter and Mike

item.title: Bari Weiss's Terrible Substack
item.description:
Welcome to the If Books Could Kill Patreon! We're happy and grateful to have you. For our first premium episode, we're diving into the horrible depths of Bari Weiss's Substack, "Common Sense" (as a side note, we'll be inquiring with regulators about whether her use of that term is legal). Join us as we discuss three of the worst posts we've ever read.

  • "Free Bird: On Elon Musk and Twitter"  
  • "Yesterday I Was Levi’s Brand President. I Quit So I Could Be Free." 
  • "We Ignored Salman Rushdie's Warning" 

You can play the episode directly through Patreon or use our RSS feed to add it to your podcast app. Here are the instructions from Patreon. We really do appreciate the support, we're not exaggerating when we say we've been blown away by the reaction to the show so far. 

Let us know in the comments if you've got suggestions for other sites of American bedumbening we should cover on future bonus episodes. Have a great rest of the year and see you next month,

PM
